name: funin

stmt.origin: ax-mp(wi(wfun(c0), wfun(cin(c0, c1))), wss(cin(c0, c1), c0))

body.origin:
|- wi(wfun(c0), wfun(cin(c0, c1)))
-| wss(cin(c0, c1), c0)
-| wi(wss(cin(c0, c1), c0), wi(wfun(c0), wfun(cin(c0, c1))))

cumulated.origin:
|- wi(wfun(c0), wfun(cin(c0, c1)))
-| wss(cin(c0, c1), c0)
-| wi(wss(cin(c0, c1), c0), wi(wfun(c0), wfun(cin(c0, c1))))

|- wi(wfun(c0), wfun(cin(c0, c1)))
-| wi(wss(cin(c0, c1), c0), wi(wfun(c0), wfun(cin(c0, c1))))

body.origin: |- wi(wss(cin(c0, c1), c0), wi(wfun(c0), wfun(cin(c0, c1))))

comment: The intersection with a function is a function. Exercise 14(a) of [Enderton] p. 53. (Contributed by NM, 19-Mar-2004.) (Proof shortened by Andrew Salmon, 17-Sep-2011.)
